intro: Horkelia tenella, commonly known as the narrowleaf horkelia, is a small flowering plant native to the western United States. It typically grows in open, rocky habitats such as grasslands and sagebrush steppe. The plant produces delicate, blue to purple flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs. Horkelia tenella is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is known for its low-growing, mat-forming structure.
